column4: If I do a dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/hda will that for sure to a zero write on every single part of my hdd or is there a chance it may leave some area untouched, which may potentially have part of a rootkit?
you sure there is nothing BEHIND byte 0 on the hdd? That you need special commands to get to?
it's safer to put random bits if you're trying to hide something
thebigham how far are you from an ap?
